text:
Comforting and satisfying meal! We can choose from a wide variety of fresh ingredients to complement the flavourful lala soup! My personal favourites are tiger prawn, shabu shabu beef, scallop, fish slice, chicken slice, burst ball and shiitake.

ðŸ“£Check out my IG/Lemon8/Tiktok @samlivestoeat for more detailed foodie reviews! ðŸ¥°

Saw on TikTok and decided to pay a visit. The lala broth is pretty good but feels like the clams are rather small and the shells took up a lot of space in the small pot. The ingredients are fairly fresh and also fairly priced. Beef slices are fatty perfect for hotpot. The prawn paste was also very fresh. Broth is refillable self service so it's good. The environment can be rather stuffy with the hot fire and smoke sometimes get in your face. Maybe sitting in the open will be better. We paid $75 for 2 adults and 1 kid which is alright I think.

Decided to drop by a visit since I am around viewing one of Ubi showrooms and this didnâ€™t disappoint! Its 15mins walk from MRT. Owner is very generous with lala and not stingy with multiple refills of soup and èŠ±è°ƒé…’ï¼Œwhich you can help yourself withðŸ¥°ðŸ¥° Ingredients on the other hand is on pricey end but you are paying for the quality afterall! One of the best charcoal lala I had in SG, definitely will be backâ€™

Tried the lala soup pot, the clams are fresh but bit small. The rest of the ingredients which include pork belly, fish paste, mushroom, and vege were all fresh as well. Price is a bit on the high side but quite reasonable, total around $50 for lala pot, 2 vege, 1 mushroom, 1 pork and 1 fish paste. They also provide free flow soup refill and hua tiao!
Came here for late lunch! The soup was shiok the lala was fresh, portion alot too! $7.90 was what this costs. The soup better than BEAUTY in the Pot lala soup btw!! TOTALLY WOULD RECOMMEND
